snippet: Both Democrats and Republicans have long used formulas that award a state’s delegates based not just on population, but also on party loyalty in previous elections.
abstract: Both Democrats and Republicans, under a set of arcane rules, have long used formulas that award a state’s delegates based not just on population, but also on party loyalty in previous elections; if the Republican nominating contest becomes a long grind to the convention, smaller and much more conservative states would have as much of a voice as some of the larger swing states where general elections are usually won or lost.
lead_paragraph: Both Democrats and Republicans have long used formulas that award a state’s delegates based not just on population, but also on party loyalty in previous elections.

headline.seo: Delegate System Gives Small States Clout at Convention
headline.main: Delegate System Gives Small States Outsize Clout at Convention
headline.print_headline: System of Rewards Can Give Small States Big Voice at Convention
